image.altText: Donald Trump speaks from behind a lectern in front of a giant American flag, holding up a document.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese vows to avoid a "race to the bottom" after US President Donald Trump unveiled a raft of global tariffs, including a 10 per cent reciprocal tariff on Australian imports to the US. Follow live.

title.children: Trump tariffs: Australian stocks slide as US tariffs shock global markets

image.altText: Image shows congestion and traffic delays. You can see cars, grey road on a gloomy day.

props.synopsis: Global car makers are rapidly reorganising in the wake of United States President Donald Trump's tariffs on automotive imports to the United States â€” and some are weighing pulling models from Australia with a climate impost about to take effect.

title.children: Popular car brands could pull models, lift prices, as tariffs collide with emission laws

image.altText: A man in a suit stands before a row of US flags

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says his Liberation Day trade tariff bonanza will bring in a "golden age" for America but the self-confidence and psychology behind them will be tested in coming months, Americas editor John Lyons writes.

title.children: Trump is the ultimate crash-through politician. Are tariffs his brick wall?

image.altText: A middle aged woman with her sleeve rolled up and a bandaid on her arm.

props.synopsis: The shingles vaccine could be an effective intervention for dementia, with a large "natural experiment" in Wales finding a substantial drop in dementia risk for those who received the vaccine.

title.children: Shingles vaccine study finds 'huge protective signal' against dementia

image.altText: A close up of a face of a toy boxer with red headgear.

props.synopsis: Shincheonji calls itself a religious organisation based on the teachings of the Bible, but former members say there is a much darker side â€” one that consumes its members' lives, controls their movements and uses threats of divine retribution to prevent them from leaving.

title.children: From Bible study to 'brainwashed': How an international church is recruiting

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holding on to several people as he takes a tumble.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton are back on the hustings after taking the morning to respond to the latest round of Trump tariffs. Follow live.

title.children: Federal election: Albanese falls off stage, Dutton is asked to clarify US remarks

image.altText: Gina Rinehart Peter Dutton composite

props.synopsis: A senior Coalition source told the ABC Ms Rinehart believed the opposition leader was not sufficiently pro-business.

title.children: Peter Dutton and Gina Rinehart fall out over Coalition gas plan, net zero

image.altText: Kim Williams appears serious, wearing a suit and glasses as he stands in front of a sombre-looking background.

props.synopsis: ABC chair Kim Williams says he has "no doubt" Liberal leader Peter Dutton would initiate a funding review of the national public broadcaster if he wins the upcoming federal election.

title.children: 'Game on': ABC chair anticipates funding review if Dutton wins election

image.altText: Donald Trump holds a list of tariffs by country.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank's latest financial stability review identifies three key risks to financial stability, and Donald Trump's tariff announcement worsens all of them.

title.children: Trump's tariffs hit all the RBA's key risks for the financial system

image.altText: Two glasses of red wine.

props.synopsis: It's Liberation Day in the US â€” a term coined by Donald Trump to signal the day the country gets its "money and respect back" by imposing tariffs on a number of international trade partners.

title.children: What Trump's tariffs could mean for Australian exports

image.altText: Val Kilmer trach

props.synopsis: Four years before his death, actor Val Kilmer shared more than 800 hours of footage from throughout his life to make a moving documentary.

title.children: What we learnt about Val Kilmer's illness from his documentary

image.altText: A submarine moves through the water causing a massive wake behind it, some crew visible above deck.

props.synopsis: The United Kingdom launches a parliamentary inquiry into the AUKUS partnership, with its scope to include the "impact of geopolitical shifts" on the deal since it was signed.

title.children: Britain launches AUKUS parliamentary inquiry amid 'geopolitical shifts'

image.altText: Kylie Truswell-Mobbs and David Mobbs smile while sitting next to each other with their heads together at a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Police will allege 50-year-old Kylie Truswell-Mobbs administered a lethal dose of prescription medication to her 56-year-old partner.

title.children: Woman charged with murdering partner with MND in 'last stages of life'

image.altText: The former foster father of Kaydence Mills holds a photo album of the toddler.

props.synopsis: Two-year-old Kaydence Mills was killed by her stepfather Tane Desatge at Chinchilla on the Western Downs in 2017 â€” just months after child protection services returned her to her biological mother, Sinitta Dawita.

title.children: Inquest to probe murder of toddler whose death wasn't noticed for years

image.altText: A woman wearing Islamic dress stands on a pile of rubble and concrete after an airstrike.

props.synopsis: Gaza's health ministry says children are among the dead in an Israeli strike on a UN-run clinic in the strip's north, where people had been sheltering.

title.children: Dozens killed, tens of thousands displaced as Israel signals Gaza land grab

image.altText: Rescuers carry out search and rescue on damaged buildings in the aftermath of an earthquake.

props.synopsis: State-run media in Myanmar announces the military's ceasefire call, which comes after days of pressure from international aid groups and humanitarian organisations.

title.children: Myanmar military announces temporary ceasefire following earthquake

image.altText: A still from a Studio Ghibli animated film showing a young girl in traditional Japanese dress.

props.synopsis: The frenzy to create Ghibli-style art using ChatGPT has sparked a heated debate about the ethical concerns of AI-generated art, copyright issues and the future livelihoods of artists.

title.children: Why the AI-generated 'Studio Ghibli' trend is so controversial

image.altText: Smartphone displaying the TikTok logo with a blurred, larger version in the background.

props.synopsis: A US ban on the platform is set to take effect on April 5 if it is not sold to an approved buyer.

title.children: Amazon makes last-minute bid to buy TikTok as deadline looms

image.altText: Luke Beveridge walking during the Bulldogs win over Carlton

props.synopsis: Luke Beveridge believes coaches are 'helpless' surrounding guiding players how to tackle and says even umpires are unsure on how to correctly penalise tackling in the AFL.

title.children: Bulldogs coach slams AFL rules, claims 'the whole competition is confused'

image.altText: A sea creature that is translucent orange being help by a hand towards the camera.

props.synopsis: From giant sea spiders to "sea pigs" and "sea butterflies" â€” analysing the rich biodiversity in Antarctica has thrilled researchers studying the impacts of climate change.

title.children: Scientists collect unique sea creatures during voyage to East Antarctica

image.altText: Adelaide businessman Solomon Farah wears sunglasses and a suit as he is questioned by journalists on a city street

props.synopsis: An Adelaide businessman accused of sexually assaulting nine women over two decades has been ordered to stand trial, and lost a request to have his home detention bail conditions relaxed.

title.children: Businessman accused of sexual assault loses 'unacceptable' bail relaxation bid

image.altText: A woman wearing a black t-shirt, standing next to a tall man, orange shirt, straw hat and eye-patch. Standing on front porch.

props.synopsis: Darwin, Australia's smallest capital city, has been ranked the country's second-most-expensive place to rent a house, along with Canberra. A local shelter says the city is in desperate need of more affordable housing.

title.children: Australia's smallest capital city has second-highest rental house prices

image.altText: a silhouette of a man in a wheelchair in a room

props.synopsis: Jim* moved into an apartment rented by a disability company linked to suspected NDIS fraudster Khawaja Haroon. He's now facing homelessness and has paid thousands of dollars of his NDIS funding for services he didn't receive.Â

title.children: 59yo's eviction linked to suspected multi-million-dollar NDIS scam

image.altText: close up of a woman's blotchy face

props.synopsis: A customer suffering a severe reaction to a skincare balm says she warned Kmart a month before a teen was hospitalised.

title.children: Calls for regulation as another Kmart customer experiences skin damage

image.altText: An inner-city building that's adorned with pink and blue decorations, windows with yellow trim jutting out from the facade

props.synopsis: If you were walking down the street, could you pick a Victorian terrace from a Federation bungalow? Restoration Australia host and professor of architecture Anthony Burke walks us through five popular design eras.

title.children: Art deco to postmodern â€” your cheat sheet for design eras

image.altText: Peter Reith and John Howard in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Former prime minister John Howard has always downplayed involvement in the waterfront dispute, but new evidence raises more questions about the government's knowledge of the events leading up to it.Â

title.children: New evidence about 1998 waterfront dispute

image.altText: Map showing the path of a cyclone heading towards the Queensland coastline.

props.synopsis: An AI forecast about ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred's path was far more accurate than leading weather models used by meteorological organisations.

title.children: AI picked Cyclone Alfred hitting Qld before traditional weather models

image.altText: A person stands looking up at large wall filled with different sized framed paintings of flowers.

props.synopsis: An impressive exhibition full of hundreds of flowers â€” painted, sculpted and woven into dresses â€” makes a powerful point about our connection to the environment, and the value of slowing down to appreciate it.

title.children: Why we turn to flowers at weddings, funerals and to decorate our underwear

image.altText: A graphic of the commemorative $1 coin, titled Swift and Sure.

props.synopsis: The Mint has released a $1 coin for the centenary of the Royal Australian Corps of Signals, complete with a secret encoded message.

title.children: Can you solve the code on this new $1 coin?

image.altText: A teenage boy with spiky, gelled hair stands with a guitar and a collared shirt on-stage against a spray-painted backdrop.

props.synopsis: Partially an ode to the legendary Flying Nun Records, Head South is also a deeply personal coming-of-age story, inspired by its director's teen years.

title.children: Head South is a love letter to New Zealand's post-punk scene

image.altText: A picture of Brian Cole and his partner Brooke embracing and holding their daughter between them on a beach.

props.synopsis: Brian Cole says his mother wanted him to become a doctor or a lawyer. He became a chef instead.

title.children: How chef Brian Cole juggles late nights, stressful shifts and fatherhood

image.altText: Chrishell smiles softly as she reclines on a pastel pink armchair while wearing a baby blue co-ord, hair down.

props.synopsis: The dating show Love Triangle is back for its third season, with reality royalty Chrishell Stause hosting the show's first reunion special. We catch up with the Selling Sunset star to find out why, how life's going with G Flip and what she's watching right now.

title.children: What Selling Sunset's Chrishell wishes you knew about reality TV
